text: 13.49 At present, there are no standardised national targets for embodied carbon emissions due to limited evidence and research on the topic, and the lack of consistent measurements and benchmarks is a key issue faced by the construction industry. Delivering an alignment in embodied carbon measurement is an important interim step towards developing net zero carbon targets that reflect the UKâ€™s carbon budget. To address the issue of misaligned targets, LETI have identified best practice targets for upfront embodied carbon, which refers to the initial amount of embodied carbon associated with the building (Building Life Cycle Stages A1-A5 excluding sequestration).
